ussr.model
Interface Controller

All Known Subinterfaces:
ActBasedController, NativeControllerProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
ActControllerImpl, ATRONCarController1, ATRONCarControllerForTiltSensorExperiments, ATRONCarControllerRemoteControl, ATRONController, ATRONNativeController, ATRONNetworkController, ATRONRoleController1, ATRONSampleController1, ATRONSimpleVehicleController1, ATRONSnakeController1, ATRONSnakeController2, ATRONTestController1, ControllerImpl, EightToCarSimulationJ.EightController, MTRANController, MTRANSampleController1, NativeController, OdinActBasedController, OdinBallController, OdinController, OdinNativeController, OdinSampleController1, OdinSampleController2, OdinSampleController3, OdinSampleHingeController, OdinSampleWheelController, SnakeCarDemo.CarStuffController, WhiteController, WhiteSampleController1
public interface Controller

Interface the simulator expects user-defined controllers to implement, allowing hardware to be associated with the controller and the controller to be started in its own thread.

Author:
Modular Robots @ MMMI
See Also:
ControllerImpl

Method Summary
 void activate()
          This method is called by the simulator in a separate thread, and should define the computations performed by the module.
 Module getModule()
          Get the module associated with the controller
 void setModule(Module module)
          This method is called by the simulator to provide the controller code with a reference to the module.
 

Method Detail

activate

void activate()
This method is called by the simulator in a separate thread, and should define the computations performed by the module. Activate will only be called once the hardware has been set up.

See Also:
setModule(Module)

setModule

void setModule(Module module)
This method is called by the simulator to provide the controller code with a reference to the module.

Parameters:
module - the hardware to associate with the controller

getModule

Module getModule()
Get the module associated with the controller

Returns:
the representation of the module hardware
